page.title: 02 The Town of Rushden
page.content: A portion of Rushden's housing falls within the block, but the section it crosses clearly shows the town's growth from oldest centre along Bedford Road, through terraced housed streets to some recent estate developments. The original town was sited in a valley, but a housing explosion in late 19th century caused the town centre to move as red brick terraced houses and associated shoe factories spread out- wards on either side of A.6. This shoe industry arose due to increased demand for shoes. Leather was supplied by the local tanning industry. Duchy land surrounding other towns and villages restricted their growth. Rushden is now a densely populated area almost independent in its amenities, with ribbon-like development stretching along Bedford Road, Newton Road and Avenue Road.
